title.narrative: Youth Employment and Livelihood Support Project (YALES)

description.narrative: The project aims to contribute to the development problem of youth unemployment and inactive citizenship causing hopelessness and social evils such as crime violence poverty homelessness break up of families alcoholism prostitution and abuse. Economies in Southern Africa are not generating enough job opportunities despite the positive economic growth and thus the project aims to increase employment prospects and improve livelihood for vulnerable young adults in identified communities in Southern Africa.Imme diate objectives are 1) to enhance knowledge and support capacity of the local communities on issues affecting youth 2) to increase knowledge and capacities of the youth to access employment and livelihood with special focus on innovative use of social med ia technology and recycled materials and 3) to improve collaboration between project?s stakeholders for joint advocacy on youth issue.Alarming share of youth notably girls has been left out from education and employment and remained vulnerable. The project respects and addresses their human rights and well-being by empowering them to become subjects of their own development and the society as a whole. As such it aims to reduce inequality and promote gender equality. Project respects climate sustainability.T he final beneficiaries are youth between the ages of 18-34 years old who are unemployed and unskilled and from rural vulnerable communities. The indirect beneficiary of the project are the employees of Evangelical Lutheran Church of Southern Africa (ELCSA) who will trained in youth work and counselling skills. The project does not create any new structure or institution but will be positioned at the existing structures of ELCSA-DS. Key activities include awareness raising for communities on youth issues tra ining of community youth counsellors compiling needs and resource analysis developing a holistic YALES training programme organising training programmes for targeted youth (including tailor made choises of career guidance vocational training counselling ap prenticeship micro-entrepreneurship training mentoring) special trainings on innovative use of social media technology and recycled materials establishing peer support groups organising training on advocacy sharing of experiences in South-South and South -North contexts and network building with stakeholders.
